sub_topic: The Higgs boson and its properties
message_1: What is the value of the mass of the Higgs boson in electron-volts (eV) based on the latest measurements from the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) experiments?
message_2: The latest measurements from the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) experiments indicate that the mass of the Higgs boson is approximately 125.1 GeV/c² (giga-electron volts) or 125,100 MeV/c² (mega-electron volts).
